text:
SARAH JESSICA PARKER:
When I was eight

and I did "The Little Match
Girl," a whole new world
opened up to me.
It's my best work.
It's really good.
I'm not kidding.
[music playing]

We didn't have a
television growing up,
so we saw a lot of theater.

We went to the movies on New
Year's Eve day every year

and saw fantastic films,
films that were probably

inappropriate, meaning
they were probably

too sophisticated or mature
for me or my younger siblings.

It was my parents'
fervent wish that we'd
be exposed to the arts.

That cultivated that
interest in our own lives.
I want a challenge.

I want to do
something that makes

me very nervous, even anxious
to the point of distraction,
you know?

I also have to
make choices based

on the time away from my family
and how they feel about that.

I get to contemplate
those choices.

And most working
mothers in this country

don't have the freedom to sort
of ponder the choices the way
I do.
They simply have to work.

So that's a huge privilege,
to get to choose.
[music playing]

As a producer, I will
watch a rough cut

to make sure it felt like
the story we wanted to tell.

But once I've done
the work, I mean,

they'll tell us to
come to a premiere,
and we need to sit through that.

And that's a certain very
sort of specific agony,
and then I'm done.

And if I should pass it on
television, that's in fact,
exactly what I will do, pass.

It's hard not to love the
life of Carrie Bradshaw,
because it was just so complete.

It was so-- it's the life I've
known the most outside my own.

A sort of alternate universe
existed for about 10 years.

So I got to be
somebody else, which
most people don't get to do.

It's probably a really
healthy way of being yourself.
Some no's are deserved.

And no's are often the
best answer you can get.
When you have an--

professional experience,
you know what to fight
and what not to.
I am a bitter ender.

It's a fatal flaw
in some instances.

And in other
instances, it's been

reasons that I've had some
success, because I have dreams.

I am not afraid to
stand in the shower

and, like, have
crazy big dreams.

Because the worst thing that
can happen is they don't happen.
Like, that's it.

Like you can't
have the experience
if you don't at least try.
